segment.source: You can use Administrative template settings for Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) to centrally configure AGPM Server connections for Group Policy administrators to whom a Group Policy object (GPO) with these settings is applied.
segment.target: You can use Administrative template settings for Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) to centrally configure AGPM Server connections for Group Policy administrators to whom a Group Policy object (GPO) with these settings is applied.

segment.source: The following settings are available under User ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsAGPM when editing a GPO.
segment.target: The following settings are available under User ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsAGPM when editing a GPO.

segment.source: If this path is not visible, right-click Administrative Templates, and add the agpm.admx or agpm.adm template.
segment.target: If this path is not visible, right-click Administrative Templates, and add the agpm.admx or agpm.adm template.

segment.source: If enabled, this setting centrally configures one AGPM Server connection for use by all domains and disables the settings on the AGPM Server tab for Group Policy administrators.
segment.target: If enabled, this setting centrally configures one AGPM Server connection for use by all domains and disables the settings on the AGPM Server tab for Group Policy administrators.

segment.source: For multiple AGPM Servers, configure this setting with a default server and then configure the AGPM Server setting in the Administrative template to override this server for other domains.
segment.target: For multiple AGPM Servers, configure this setting with a default server and then configure the AGPM Server setting in the Administrative template to override this server for other domains.

segment.source: If disabled or not configured, each Group Policy administrator must select the AGPM Server to display for each domain on the AGPM Server tab in AGPM.
segment.target: If disabled or not configured, each Group Policy administrator must select the AGPM Server to display for each domain on the AGPM Server tab in AGPM.

segment.source: If enabled, this setting centrally configures multiple domain-specific AGPM Servers, overriding the AGPM Server (all domains) setting in the Administrative template.
segment.target: If enabled, this setting centrally configures multiple domain-specific AGPM Servers, overriding the AGPM Server (all domains) setting in the Administrative template.

segment.source: If your environment requires only a single AGPM Server, use only the AGPM Server (all domains) setting in the Administrative template.
segment.target: If your environment requires only a single AGPM Server, use only the AGPM Server (all domains) setting in the Administrative template.

segment.source: If disabled or not configured, the AGPM Server (all domains) setting in the Administrative template configures the AGPM Server connection.
segment.target: If disabled or not configured, the AGPM Server (all domains) setting in the Administrative template configures the AGPM Server connection.
